speaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series
text: Adam Arkin  * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}    _Act 1  Scene 1 - KACL  Fade in.  Frasier is on the air._

speaker: Frasier
text: Welcome back, Seattle.  Thank you for joining us for this, our two thousandth show.  Hard to believe, isn't it Roz?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Roz
text: No, that feels just about right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes, well what a festive day this is.  No stop has been un-pulled.  I would like to take this opportunity to acknowledge the anniversary luncheon spread supplied by our friends at Senor Jose Fong, home of the sweet and sour taco.

speaker: Frasier
text: And don't forget, a little later, we'll have Microsoft chairman Bill Gates, live in studio to congratulate me on my two thousandth show.  Apparently, I hear through the grapevine, he is a big fan.  Roz, what do we have next?

speaker: Roz
text: It's time for another blooper.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I believe we're up to number four, as voted by you, the listeners.  Here's what happened when a certain producer... [_Roz grins sheepishly_] didn't realize her microphone was on, during the show...

speaker: Roz
text: [_on tape_] Now what the [_beep_] is this!?  You call this a [_beep_] paycheck?!  How the [_beep_] am I supposed to live on this [_beep_]!?  I'm gonna have a little word with that [_beep_]- damn station manager, walking around here like he owns the mother-[_beep_]-ing place! _Kenny has entered during this last sentence.  As Frasier and Roz are cracking up listening to the tape, he leans over the guest mike._

speaker: Kenny
text: Can't believe that wasn't voted number one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ladies and gentlemen, it's our station manager, KACL's own Kenny Daly.

speaker: Kenny
text: Listen, Doc, I got a special someone out there who'd like to say "Hello".

speaker: Frasier
text: By all means, let's bring him in, Kenny.  Ladies and gentlemen, our special guest has finally arrived.  Please welcome...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...Bulldog!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Great to see you, Doc.  Hey, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, ladies and gentlemen, it's our old friend and former colleague, Bob "Bulldog" Briscoe.  Thanks for coming down and helping me celebrate my two thousandth show.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, yeah congrats.  I didn't' think you'd last two weeks. Listen up, sports fans, Bulldog here!  I know what you're all thinking: Bulldog's been gone too long.  How can you get me back on the air?  Okay, listen up.  You send your cards and letters of support to Kenny Daly, KACL, PO Box....

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog, our special guest has arrived.

speaker: Bulldog
text: PO Box 451, Seattle...

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog!  Would you and your noisemaker wait in Roz's booth?

speaker: Bulldog
text: This is an air horn, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I was referring to that flapping hole above your chin, now get out!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ladies and gentlemen, let's please welcome Microsoft chairman Bill Gates. Good to see you, sir.

speaker: Bill
text: Sorry I was late.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's quite all right.

speaker: Bill
text: I was just talking to an old friend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes. _Noel passes by the window and flashes Bill the Vulcan "Live Long and Prosper" sign.  Bill gives him a thumbs up as Frasier and Roz share a surprised look._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've got so many questions to ask you, why don't we just dive right in?  I've been wondering, when did you first become a fan of my show?

speaker: Roz
text: Excuse me, Warren from Kirkland is on line two.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Roz, I won't be taking any calls until after Mr. Gates has left.

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, it's for Mr. Gates.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, go ahead, caller, you're on with Mr. Bill Gates.

speaker: Warren
text: [_v.o._] Yeah, hi, Mr. Gates.  I bought your new Windows XP program and I'm about to install it as an upgrade.  Do I have to make a boot disk?

speaker: Bill
text: That's a very good question, you don't need to make a boot disk.  You just put the CD in and it'll upgrade.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hope that answers your question, Warren...

speaker: Bill
text: It's a feature of XP, very quick, very smooth.  Hey, this is fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you for calling, Warren.  Now, where were we?

speaker: Roz
text: Can Mr. Gates take a few more calls?  The board is lighting up!  Wow, who knew we had a line seven?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I believe Mr. Gates is probably anxious to get on with the interview?

speaker: Bill
text: No, no, I'm happy to.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well.  Go ahead, caller.

speaker: Estelle
text: [_v.o._] Wow, Bill Gates, this is so cool!

speaker: Bill
text: Thank you.

speaker: Estelle
text: Hey, I have a question about multi-lingual user interface add-ons.  What are those?

speaker: Bill
text: Well, the multi-lingual add-ons let you run Windows in different languages.  You can use it in German or...

speaker: Frasier
text: Can you believe that egomaniacal gasbag?  He's taking over my show!

speaker: Roz
text: Don't you think you're exaggerating just a bit?

speaker: Bill
text: Who do we have next, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Bob, from Freemont.  He has a question about his laptop.

speaker: Bill
text: Go ahead, Bob, I'm listening. _The others happily watch as Frasier stands there, fuming.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Frasier comes into his bedroom, lays his jacket on the bed and opens his briefcase.  He takes out a tape._

speaker: Frasier
text: Two thousand shows. _He walks to the armoire and opens it, revealing a collection of all his shows.  He put the tape in the next open slot and reverently passes a hand across the collection.  Niles calls from the living room._

speaker: Niles
text: Hurry up, Frasier, we're gonna miss the reservations!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I'll be right there. _He goes to his dressing room and puts on a different jacket.  Coming back, he closes the armoire and heads for the living room, only to stop short, a disturbed look on his face.  He goes back and opens up the armoire, then jerks in shock and gasps.  CUT TO: the living room. Niles, Daphne and Martin are waiting for Frasier._

speaker: Daphne
text: Two thousand shows.  That's quite a milestone.

speaker: Niles
text: It certainly is.  Can anyone tell me what happened today? I forgot to listen.

speaker: Martin
text: I just listened for five minutes in case he asks me what my favorite part was.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just say the call from Tacoma.  There's bound to be a call from Tacoma.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, could I see all of you in my room for just a jiff?

speaker: Martin
text: But I'm hungry!

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, are we all here?  Good.

speaker: Martin
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: Something is amiss.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll say.  I always thought that was a sweater cubby.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well it's not.  It's a collection of all my shows.  I was just examining my collection when I realized that someone had placed one of my tapes upside down.

speaker: Martin
text: What kind of sick, twisted... well, turn it right side up and let's go eat!  You probably did it yourself!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, conceivably, but... I guarantee you I would never remove my tape from the case and replace it with "The Best of Hall and Oates."  All right, I won't be mad, just tell me: who did this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nobody did this?

speaker: Martin
text: Tell you what, I did it.  Now can we go eat?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not so fast, Dad.  Okay, let's examine the evidence. _The others all let out groans.  Martin sits down on the bed, Niles takes the desk chair, Daphne wanders back._

speaker: Frasier
text: A Hall and Oates tape.  That rules you out, Dad.  And it definitely rules out Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_in tears_] Dr. Crane...

speaker: Frasier
text: Or does it?  Perhaps the tape is just a red herring, meant to throw me off the scent.  A psychological game.  There's only one of you that would combat me on that level.

speaker: Daphne
text: I did it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah-ha!

speaker: Niles
text: You can't say "Ah ha", you thought it was me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why'd you do it, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't mean to.  I was trying to listen to a tape in that boom box you gave me for Christmas.  Only I wasn't getting any sound and I didn't know if it were the tape or the boom box and I didn't have any other tapes so I grabbed one of your tapes just to test the boom box out and it turns out it was the boom box after all.  Only then I couldn't get it out of the boom box so I used a screwdriver to pry it out and I broke the tape, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: There, there, Daphne...

speaker: Frasier
text: Stand down, Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, do you realize what you've done?  This isn't like any other tape you can go down to your local music shop and purchase, it's unique.  And irreplaceable.

speaker: Niles
text: Can't you just get the station to make you a copy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Unless I get the station to make me another copy.  Which of course I can.  The only transgression here is that Daphne didn't come to me with the truth.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm so sorry, Dr. Crane, I will never to you lie again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if that's what you've learned, it was all worth it. So, what are we all sitting here for.  I believe we all have a two thousandth show to celebrate.

speaker: Niles
text: Hear, hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, did you all listen?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, did we.

speaker: Martin
text: Great.

speaker: Daphne
text: I especially liked that call from Tacoma.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, which one? _FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - KACL  Fade in.  Frasier and Roz enter a room filled with boxes._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, in nine years this is the first time I've been down to the archives.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God, I remember this place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Roz
text: I came down here once after a Christmas party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Whatever for?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I had a little too much champagne, and you know how you get a little lonely around the holidays?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Brings back memories, huh, Roz?

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog!

speaker: Bulldog
text: That was some Christmas, huh?  When Santa left a bit of Bulldog in your stockings?

speaker: Roz
text: You're disgusting!

speaker: Bulldog
text: What, I went too far?  Why don't you come back here, I'll slip you an apology.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Bulldog's still got it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog, what the hell are you doing here?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, this is my new job.  I, uh, catalogue the archive.  You know, I clean up a bit.  But I figure I'll be back on the air in no time, as long as I attack this job with my trademark "Can Do" attitude.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great, then. We're looking for a copy of my show, episode 893.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No can do.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Bulldog
text: What?  I've only been here an hour, I don't even know where the john is.  Where's my Powerbar?  I had a Powerbar here. SOMEONE STOLE MY POWERBAR!  THIS STINKS!  THIS IS TOTAL B.S.! THIS IS... oh, here it is.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, here's a box marked "Best of Crane".

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thanks Roz, let's have a look.  Ah, good.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's just a few tapes in here.  All right, keep looking.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, hey, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, just the man I was looking for.  Listen, where are all the tapes of my shows kept?

speaker: Kenny
text: You got 'em.  Right there.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, where are the rest of them?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Kenny
text: There are no rest.  We record over them.  I mean, look around, Doc, we've got a space problem down here.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Kenny, where do you want me to put these snow tires?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, put 'em right to my kids' bikes. **IT'S A FANCY WAY TO SAY "FAVOR"**  _Scene 4 - KACL  Fade in.  Frasier is on the air._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good afternoon, Seattle.  Before we go to the phones, I have a boon to ask of you.  If any of you happens to have in your possession a tape of my broadcast from June 14, 1996, I am in need of a copy.  You see, I understand that from time to time, people who call into my show record it, perhaps in order to review my advice or even to play it for some friends.  Now, I realize this is a bit of a long shot, but it is the only missing tape of my collection and therefore of course has great sentimental value.  Thanks for your consideration.  Now, Roz, who's our first caller?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Joe from Bachon Island on line one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead Joe, I'm listening.

speaker: Joe
text: [_v.o._] About that missing tape...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes?

speaker: Joe
text: I know what you're going through.  A couple years ago, I was in a taxi cab and lost a gold cuff link.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and this relates to my missing tape how?

speaker: Joe
text: Well, it's missing and I'm bummed.  It had the initials "J.S." on it.  If anyone finds it, I'd love to have it back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm sure you would, but unless it's about my missing tape, well then I would prefer to stick to calls about mental and emotional issues as usual.  Thank you for your call. Who's our next caller, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Phyllis from Green Lake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Phyllis, go ahead, I'm listening.

speaker: Phyllis
text: [_v.o._] My cat ran away last Wednesday.  She's orange with a white chest and one white paw...

speaker: Frasier
text: Phyllis, all right.  Hold on, hold on a minute!  All right now, listen to me people.  I don't want to turn this show into the lost and found bin of the airwaves.  Phyllis, I'm going to let you finish your description of your cat and then we're going back to our regular show, all right?

speaker: Phyllis
text: Okay.   She has green eyes, a rhinestone collar, and when she's happy...

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's recap: in the last three hours, we have located a missing engagement ring, one lost cuff link, two missing cats, and we've actually reunited Eric from Belltown with his biological parents.  Still, sadly, no sign of my missing tape.  To that end, listeners, please scour you attics, basements, hope chests, whatever.  Meantime, this is Doctor Frasier Crane wishing you good day and good mental health. And don't forget to look behind things.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's all right, Roz.  It'll turn up, I mean it's only the first day.  Word'll get around, I'm sure somebody has that tape.

speaker: Roz
text: I just don't want you to get your hopes up too high.  Chances are, that tape is gone for good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if that's the case, then so be it.  Life will go on. _He heads out the door.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 5 - Frasier's bedroom. Frasier is trying to sleep, tossing and turning, but still staring at the empty spot in his collection.  FADE OUT  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **THE LOST WEEKEND** _Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Frasier comes into the living room in his bathrobe._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.  How was your nap?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely.  Daphne, could you make me a cup of tea, please, and whatever meal would be appropriate for this time of day? _He plops down on the couch.  Eddie puts his head in his lap while Daphne sits on the arm of the couch to comfort him._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, you've been in bed all weekend.  How about going for a nice walk?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thanks.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, how about going to a movie then?  Take your mind off your troubles.

speaker: Frasier
text: My car's in the shop.

speaker: Daphne
text: You could take public transportation. _Frasier lets out a little laugh, then quiets down again.  The doorbell rings._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I wonder who this could be? [_She opens the door._] Oh, look, it's your brother Niles, here for a visit.

speaker: Niles
text: [_entering, he speaks very slowly and clearly_] Hello, Frasier, how are we today?

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell is wrong with the two of you?  You'd think I'd been found walking in the park in my underwear, talking to pigeons.

speaker: Daphne
text: Would we like a walk in the park? _Frasier gets up and heads for his room.  Niles follows.  They meet Martin coming into the living room._

speaker: Niles
text: All right, Frasier, Frasier wait...

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, lookin' good, buddy.

speaker: Martin
text: Not any better, huh?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, and I feel just awful.  This is all my fault.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm the one who ruined his treasured collection.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all his crap is treasured.  But look, don't feel bad. I've broken lots of his stuff.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've never heard of you breaking anything.

speaker: Martin
text: That's because I know how to cover my tracks.  Take a look at that fertility god statue over there.  It used to be a lot more fertile, if you know what I mean.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh my God!  This is a Tootsie Roll!  That's brilliant!

speaker: Martin
text: Aw, that's nothin'.  Here, check out this vase. [_he pulls down a piece of pottery_] Two years ago Eddie and me were horsin' around and I knocked it over, it took me hours to glue it back together again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why, you can't even tell.  I had no idea you were so devious.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, I'll show you how to make ginger ale look like fifty year-old brandy. _CUT TO: Frasier's bedroom. Frasier is back in bed, Niles is sitting on a chair next to him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Niles, I appreciate your concern, I really do, but frankly I am in no mood to endure therapy with my younger brother, no matter how well-intentioned.

speaker: Niles
text: I am not trying to butt in, I'm just curious as to why this tape matters so much to you.  Do you ever listen to these?

speaker: Frasier
text: Once.  When I had a date over.  Proved a useful mood setter.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay... Well, tell me this, then: do you ever intend to listen to any of the others?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't know.

speaker: Niles
text: So, why is it so important to you to have each and every one of them?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because it's a collection, Niles.  That's what a collection is.

speaker: Niles
text: Is it possible that a harmless collection has become an unhealthy obsession?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's, it's just a hobby.  All right?

speaker: Niles
text: Or an obsession.

speaker: Frasier
text: An eccentricity.

speaker: Niles
text: Or an obsession.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's a quirk.  That's it, I'm quirky.  I'm delightfully quirky.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you realize that your delightful quirk has brought your life to a standstill?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I've just finished my two thousandth show.  I'm exhausted, physically and emotionally.  I believe that I am entitled to an entire weekend of doing nothing, don't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Do you know you have your pajamas on backwards?

speaker: Frasier
text: Another delightful quirk of mine.

speaker: Niles
text: Not from where I'm sitting.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras!  The station called, some guy has your tape.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, uh, well, thanks, Dad.  Yes, well, I'll tend to this by and by...

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I'll get the car.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll put on some pants.

speaker: Niles
text: Zipper goes in front. _He leaves, Frasier glaring after him.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Tom's Apartment  Fade in.  Tom is bringing a plate of snacks out of the kitchen when there is a knock at the door.  He answers it to find Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Tom
text: Hello, yes, Dr. Crane.  Please come in.  Please make yourself at home.

speaker: Frasier
text: You must be Tom.

speaker: Tom
text: And you must be the greatest radio talk show host ever!

speaker: Frasier
text: You can call me Frasier.

speaker: Niles
text: I think I'll wait outside.

speaker: Tom
text: I didn't know you were bringing someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Tom, this is my brother Niles.

speaker: Tom
text: Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Tom.

speaker: Tom
text: Hi, yes.  Uh, didn't you fill in on Frasier's show a couple of times?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, yes actually I did.

speaker: Tom
text: Yeah, yeah, you were all right.

speaker: Niles
text: You flatter me.

speaker: Tom
text: So, what's it like?

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Tom
text: Being Frasier Crane's brother?  Being able to talk to him whenever you want, having access to that great brain twenty- four hours a day?

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I think I left my lights on.

speaker: Tom
text: No, no please, don't leave yet.  Please, if you don't mind, I was hoping you'd take a picture of Frasier and I.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course he doesn't mind.  Actually, I've even brought along an eight by ten photo, personalized, of course.

speaker: Tom
text: Oh, my, that's really, I don't know...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I thought you might like that.

speaker: Tom
text: I'll have to do some rearranging, but don't worry, I'll find some room for it somewhere. _He opens the curtains on the back wall to reveal a wall full of signs, posters and photos of Frasier.  He pins the new one in place._

speaker: Niles
text: I, uh, thought that was a window.

speaker: Tom
text: Yeah, well it was.  Okay, I'm gonna go get the camera.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, this man is deeply disturbed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?  Because he has a few pictures of me on his wall?

speaker: Niles
text: This man is obviously obsessed with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is it with you?  I'm obsessed, he's obsessed.  I think you're the one who's obsessed with being obsessed.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I apologize.  He's delightfully quirky. _The answering machine picks up the phone.  The outgoing message is Frasier's voice, recorded from the show._ Machine: Go ahead caller, I'm listening. Caller: This is your mother, call me - and change that stupid message already!

speaker: Tom
text: Aw, mom, get a life, why don't you?  Here we go. [_he sits on the couch, his arm around Frasier_] Now I want to record this historic moment, because I don't want to wake up tomorrow and find out this was all part of a dream.  Because I've had this dream before.  Many times.  Sometimes we're in London, sometimes we're in Paris, sometimes we're riding mules down the Grand Canyon.

speaker: Tom
text: Oh my God!  This is gonna be the jewel of my collection.  I'm gonna get a special frame for it and I'm gonna look at it while I'm listening to the show and I... Oh, wait a minute. Uh listen, uh Frasier's brother, your thumb was in front of the lens.  If you don't mind, just one more.  And you know what, bring that chair closer come over here for a second, sit there, this is gonna be great. [_He urges Frasier over to the chair._] Sit there, just like that, and this time, why don't you act like you're giving me advice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, all right.  Tom, I was just wondering, have you ever called into the show?

speaker: Tom
text: Me?  Why would I call the show?

speaker: Tom
text: Ooh!  Did your head just touch that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm sorry.

speaker: Tom
text: Don't be. _Tom grabs a plastic container and takes the doily from the back of the chair._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, so, Tom.  I take it you've been listening to the show for some time. _Tom sits down and puts the doily in a plastic bag and then into the container._

speaker: Tom
text: Are you kidding?  From day one.  I got so hooked that eventually I started taping them so that I didn't miss anything.  I even was skipping out of work early so I could make sure to be home on time.

speaker: Niles
text: So, Tom, in a way you could say your obsession with your collection was bringing your life to a standstill.

speaker: Tom
text: Yes, yes exactly.  Until I realized how ridiculous I was being.  I mean, missing work to tape the show?

speaker: Frasier
text: Good for you, Tom.  So you could say that it's possible to have a passion for collecting without losing sight of your priorities.

speaker: Tom
text: Yes, exactly.  And that's why I quit my job.  Oh, this turned out really nice.  And you know, eventually, the money ran out so I got a gig as a night doorman.  And that way, I could - oh [_he takes the camera back from Niles_] - I could, uh, you know listen to the show a second time on my Walkman and then I could do my transcriptions at work.

speaker: Frasier
text: You transcribe the show?

speaker: Tom
text: Well, you gotta have a backup.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Tom, you know I must confess I'm a bit concerned. I'm delighted to have you as a fan, I really am.  But the whole purpose of my show is to help people live better lives, and I'm afraid that I've hurt yours.  I just... there should be more to life than... there should be more.

speaker: Tom
text: Yes, but as you always say: Life is most fulfilling when spent in the pursuit of one's passions.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but as I've also said: Weave the tapestry of your life with many diverse threads.

speaker: Tom
text: Ah, yes, but you added: Make sure to weave the pattern that pleases you most.

speaker: Niles
text: "Weave the tapestry with diverse threads"?

speaker: Tom
text: Yes, Frasier said all of these things, and many others. He is a genius.  Would you like some guacamole?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, thanks Tom.  Look, I don't really want to talk you into anything, it seems I've done enough of that already.  [_Tom hands him a chip with sauce on it._] Thank you.  Tom, what I'm getting at here is that I think there could be more to your life than just my tapes and pictures.   Now, if you'd be interested in exploring those issues further, I can recommend someone who'd be glad to talk with you.

speaker: Tom
text: Why?  I have you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Well, you know, I think it's time we got going.

speaker: Tom
text: Oh no, so soon?  Well I suppose someone like you has a lot of things they gotta do.  I'm glad you could come at all. Please, stop by any time you want.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Tom, it was a pleasure.

speaker: Tom
text: Oh, don't forget your tape.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Tom, I'd like you to keep that.

speaker: Tom
text: But, this is the reason you came.

speaker: Frasier
text: If I ever need it, I'll know where to find it.

speaker: Niles
text: Um, you know those shows where I sat in for Frasier?  You wouldn't happen to have those tapes, would you?

speaker: Tom
text: Sorry, I don't collect just anything. _Niles, disappointed, leaves.  FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Daphne is on the couch, Martin is in his chair.  Frasier and Niles come in the front._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, there he is.  Did you get your tape back?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, no I didn't.

speaker: Daphne
text: What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, tonight I saw an example of how an obsession can take over a man's life.  I don't want to be that man.  Therefore I chose to leave it and render my collection imperfect.  But that's all right, you see, I don't need things to be perfect.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Something's amiss.

speaker: Frasier
text: My double-handled amphora!  All right, no one leaves!
